text:
called a frenulotomy 
but only requires treating if 
affecting	feeding.
Some babies sleep through 
the procedure, however, most 
babies cry. A small amount 
of blood loss is expected, 
however heavy bleeding 
following the procedure is rare 
and research shows the risk of 
infection is very small. 
With increased tongue 
movement some babies must 
relearn how to feed and may 
be unsettled feeding for a day 
or two.  Occasionally (about 4 
out of every 100 babies) scar 
tissue can form which may
